Articles.Content:
**Nehemiah Engineering - Kerbal Environmental Effects Study (KEES)**

*Science and money from experiments based on real space science*

[**Download from Kerbalstuff**](https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/625/Kerbal%20Environmental%20Effects%20Study)

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/6dUIu3NjDQ8?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

**Update 0.2.1**

- Performance improvements

**Requirements**

This mod needs [Kerbal Attachment System (KAS)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92514)

**KEES Parts:**

**Experiments:**

- Polished Plate Micrometeoroid and Debris (PPMD)
- Orbital Debris Collector (ODC)
- Passive Optical Sample Assemblies I (POSA I)
- Passive Optical Sample Assemblies II (POSA II)

**Additional KEES Parts:**

- Passive Experiment Carrier (PEC) used to mount the experiment on the outside of the craft. The PEC is designed for micro gravity it will break of during high G-forces.
- Payload Container (PC) can hold one PEC and one experiment

The experiments are inspired by the [Mir Environmental Effects Payload](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mir_Environmental_Effects_Payload)

![figure2a.jpg](http://setas-www.larc.nasa.gov/meep/1-year/posa_I/figure2a.jpg)

**Other science mods from Nehemiah Engineering**

Nehemiah Engineering offers science for all tech levels.

- [Kemini Research Program (KRP)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/112337)
- [Orbital Material Science (OMS)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81578)
- [Kerbal Life Science (KLS)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/112340)
- [All-In-One Download: Nehemiah Engineering Research Program](https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/629/Nehemiah%20Engineering%20Research%20Program)

![3s1Doyj.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/3s1Doyj.jpg)

**Contributors**

- micha: CLS configurations and bug fixes.
- whiteout1911: StageRecovery support for contracts
- The Yellow Dart: Nehemiah Engineering and Kerbal Life Science flag

**Testing-Team**

- micha
- Sangrias
- volkkeslate

**License:** GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE Version 3

[**Source code and bug tracker at GitHub**](https://github.com/N3h3miah/OrbitalMaterialScience)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-13T16:59:50Z" title="03/13/2015 04:59  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 13, 2015</time> by N3h3mia**
Oh wow, that is really cool! Great work here, this concept really gives space stations a purpose.
Really awesome....but really "big"...52,2 MB (!!!) .

> 
> Really awesome....but really "big"...52,2 MB (!!!) .

That's because the textures are not compressed. png textures sometimes don't load in the current texture loader and after loading the png have the same size as the uncompressed textures.

> 
> That's because the textures are not compressed. png textures sometimes don't load in the current texture loader and after loading the png have the same size as the uncompressed textures.

Its ok,i added to GameData Folder !!!

Nice work!!! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Nice work indeed! Thanks!

Why not bundle all your mods in 1 as there all on the same lines pretty much ?

EDIT- Great job on them all but would be nice to just have to keep track of 1 main post instead of a dozen or so.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-04T16:44:21Z" title="03/04/2015 04:44  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 4, 2015</time> by Mecripp2**

> 
> That's because the textures are not compressed. png textures sometimes don't load in the current texture loader and after loading the png have the same size as the uncompressed textures.

That's news to me. I use PNG for all of my mods (a batch file I run which extracts all archives in a "downloads" folder and scans for "MBM" or "TGA" files and converts them to PNG) and I have yet to experience anything not loading properly. TGA format has problems sometimes in the current loader. Perhaps that's what you were thinking of?

> 
> That's news to me. I use PNG for all of my mods (a batch file I run which extracts all archives in a "downloads" folder and scans for "MBM" or "TGA" files and converts them to PNG) and I have yet to experience anything not loading properly. TGA format has problems sometimes in the current loader. Perhaps that's what you were thinking of?

Your right, the loading issues is limited to TGA, the problems with PNG is that sometimes PNG don't get mipmaps generated. I run into the TGA issue and replacing it with something that comes with an other issue seemed not to be the best solution. Disk space is normally not a big issue in times of TB-disks and the zip you download are highly compressed so download speed is not affected. That let me to choose MBM as texture format. [Here](https://github.com/NathanKell/RealSolarSystem/wiki/On-MBMs-and-Other-Image-Formats) is the source of my information.
What are your plans regarding KAS removing grab fuctionality?

> 
> What are your plans regarding KAS removing grab fuctionality?

I'm aware of the change but for the next weeks I'm very busy in RL so I had now time yet to look into it but I will.
Cool no big rush. Kospy hopefully won't update KAS for a little while.

Hm seems like you don't get the contract completed unless you bring home the experiment in a KEES container? 

I had it in a kerbal's KIS inventory and though i got the science for retrieving the experiment, the contract was uncompleted

> 
> Hm seems like you don't get the contract completed unless you bring home the experiment in a KEES container? 
> I had it in a kerbal's KIS inventory and though i got the science for retrieving the experiment, the contract was uncompleted

Same for me...got the science, but not the completion. Experiments finalized and stored in KIS inventory.

> 
> Same for me...got the science, but not the completion. Experiments finalized and stored in KIS inventory.

Nehemia hasn't updated the mod for KIS compatibility yet. Use KAS to grab the experiment and store the result in a command pod if you don't want to return the experiment holders back to Kerbin.

> 
> Nehemia hasn't updated the mod for KIS compatibility yet. Use KAS to grab the experiment and store the result in a command pod if you don't want to return the experiment holders back to Kerbin.

That's it. Sorry for the delay but I'm very busy right now. The contract system for KEES is older than KIS so it can not support it. It support any kind of KAS containers.

I am trying to perform the POSA I experiment. I get it set up and start it running. I go back into my capsule and wait for the experiment to complete. I am in an 71 peri 150ap type orbit. At some point, not sure where I am, I get an failure message for the experiment saying that I have change location. Well of course I have I'm in an elliptical orbit travelling very fast. Naturally my location is changing. Should I be in a Keosynchronus Orbit? Or what? I love your science mods. They add a great deal of variety to the game.
They need to be in a near circular orbit.

> 
> I am trying to perform the POSA I experiment. I get it set up and start it running. I go back into my capsule and wait for the experiment to complete. I am in an 71 peri 150ap type orbit. At some point, not sure where I am, I get an failure message for the experiment saying that I have change location. Well of course I have I'm in an elliptical orbit travelling very fast. Naturally my location is changing. Should I be in a Keosynchronus Orbit? Or what? I love your science mods. They add a great deal of variety to the game.

The location refers to the "science location" your orbit probably moves from "low in space over Kerbin" to "high in space" I don't know the number by heart. ExplorerKlatt is right, try a less elliptical orbit. And I'm glad you like the mods.
The mods are great. Okay, that makes sense. Glad it was something simple (like my inability to circularize right the first time... but I'm still getting used to FARAM Aerodynamics).

I've made an UNOFFICIAL EXPERIMENTAL build of this mod for KSP 1.x while N3h3mia is away, for testing purposes. This build also uses KIS instead of KAS (although may not work as designed; I've only done rudimentary testing).

If people want to try it out, the thread with the download link is [here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/118716). If you do try it out, DO NOT raise bug reports directly to N3h3mia nor to this thread; raise any issues or comments in the unofficial build thread, and I will collate them for N3h3mia on his return.

Great!!!

> 
> Hm seems like you don't get the contract completed unless you bring home the experiment in a KEES container? 
> I had it in a kerbal's KIS inventory and though i got the science for retrieving the experiment, the contract was uncompleted

in orbit recover the PEC and experiment tray into a KIS container

then land

then mount the PEC followed by the experiment

just be sure the ship has come to a complete stop and you mount the PEC where the wieght change won't cause the ship to roll

a slow roll caused the PEC to explode on me
